description: From Latin circum (“around”) + ambiō, from amb- (“both side”) + eō (“go”), literally "go on both sides of".

adjectives.description: circumambient (comparative more circumambient, superlative most circumambient)

examples: Philip seemed really to be born again. He breathed the circumambient air as though he had never breathed it before, and he took a child's pleasure in all the facts of the world.

adverbs.description: circumambient (comparative more circumambient, superlative most circumambient)
